body_html:
Why do you want to build without using our third_party?

We populate third_party with git hashes that we test against and that we're sure work. For most of the packages, third_party is a fallback, and cmake will preferentially find packages in CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or in system paths before finding them in third_party. More often then not, this causes problems for people when cmake picks up a system package that is misconfigured or otherwise incompatible with another package like CUDA (system Eigen often causes problems with CUDA for example).

body:
Why do you want to build without using our third_party? 

We populate third_party with git hashes that we test against and that we're sure work. For most of the packages, third_party is a fallback, and cmake will preferentially find packages in CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or in system paths before finding them in third_party. More often then not, this causes problems for people when cmake picks up a system package that is misconfigured or otherwise incompatible with another package like CUDA (system Eigen often causes problems with CUDA for example).
